caption.center: JOHN T. HULL v. RUTH E. HULL.

opinion.posture:
This is before us on a wife's motion that we "reinstate" an order entered on July 9, 1976, in the Family Court, directing the husband to pay $75 a week for the support of five minor children. Previous to that time the husband had been ordered to pay the wife $50 a week for child support. The wife states that on January 28, 1977, the trial justice stayed[fn1] his original order and since that date the husband has been paying $50 a week.
We will treat the motion to reinstate as a motion to stay the January 28, 1977 stay issued by the trial justice. Since we have this day issued an opinion in the above-entitled case sustaining the husband's appeal from the July 9, 1976 order, there is no necessity that we consider the wife's motion.Page 981 Accordingly, the motion is denied pro forma.
[fn1] The stay was issued after the papers in this case had been docketed in this court.
opinion.attorneys:
Joseph A. Capineri, for plaintiff.
John D. Lynch, for defendant.
